definition: to keep a record of events/record/to start to form memories (after one's infancy)
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: I made a memo on my memo-pad to buy more coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我在記事薄上記下了要再買些咖啡。

sentences.english: To give your enthusiasm a push in the right direction, refer to your notebook when the spiral is collapsing in on itself.
sentences.chinese: 當熱忱的螺旋轉錯方向時，不妨回顧一下你的記事簿。

sentences.english: He unclasped his briefcase and took out his notes.
sentences.chinese: 他打開公文包拿出記事本。

sentences.english: Keep a notepad at your bedside along with a gentle night-light and pen.
sentences.chinese: 牀邊放一個小記事本，一盞柔和的夜明燈和一支筆。

sentences.english: You can use Notepad for the Chinese resource properties file.
sentences.chinese: 您可以使用記事本來編輯中文資源屬性文件。

sentences.english: For example, the editor uses a notebook and tabs.
sentences.chinese: 例如，編輯器使用一個記事簿和選項卡。

sentences.english: For continuation of history, Ten Chronicles expanded the scope of records and preserved sufficient material.
sentences.chinese: 通古今的十志擴大了記事範圍，保存了豐富的內容。

sentences.english: Thirty minutes earlier, I triple-checked the address scrawled in my notebook.
sentences.chinese: 三十分鐘前，我再三確認記事本上草草寫就的地址。

sentences.english: How do you comment on the whole section about Princess Diana's affairs?
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼評論那整版的黛妃的婚外戀記事？

sentences.english: When you close Notepad, the console application will close as well.
sentences.chinese: 當你關閉記事本時，該控制檯應用程序也將關閉。

sentences.english: Get a pen and a notepad.
You can use a simple notebook, some white paper or a diary.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用記事本，日記本或者幾張白紙來記錄。

sentences.english: and the Multi-Toll NotePad, text-editing software.
sentences.chinese: 還有一個多行的記事本，是一個文本編輯軟件。

sentences.english: My favorite, by far, is AK Notepad.
sentences.chinese: 我目前最喜歡的就是AK記事本。

sentences.english: A:How do you comment on the whole section about Princess Diana's affairs?
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼評論那整版的黛妃的婚外戀記事？

definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate
serialized/published as a serial (in a newspaper)
